strings.Value: "It's a relief that you mentioned it first. In fact I've grown quite tired of you."
"I don't care. Together we can overcome any danger!"
"All right, we'll do as you say. But know that you are breaking my heart."
"Fine. In fact, this should have happened a long time ago."
{n}Tristian looks gaunt and pale. There are shadows under his eyes, and mournful wrinkles around the corners of his mouth.{/n} "{name}. We need to talk."

"Lately... lately I have been troubling you needlessly. All those questions, conversations... and everything else... I know I distracted you from your duties. It was selfish of me to demand so much of your attention. I promise it won't happen again."
{n}Tristian closes his eyes and turns away.{/n} "Perfect. I'm glad we've understood each other."

{n}Tristian winces.{/n} "Please, {name}, don't. You are a baroness, the ruler of the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g}, protector of hundreds of people. I can't distract you, especially... especially now when a baron from the neighboring lands has gone missing! The same danger might hover over you! What if... I can't let this happen!"
{n}The young man pulls away and folds his hands in front of him in a gesture of prayer.{/n} "I will pray to {g|Sarenrae}Sarenrae{/g} for you."
"No! Please, think about yourself, about those who depend on you! Many fates hanging by a thread..." {n}Tristian sighs.{/n} "Enough. It's decided."
{n}Tristian lowers his head and turns away.{/n} "Only to help you, {name}. Only to help you."
